notes:
AGATHA BRISTOL



Dear Sir,

I am Lady Agatha Bristol, CBE, of the Special
Operations Department of the Foreign Office.

My physician, Dr. Harold Shipman, has told me about
your situation. He advises me that you are trustworthy
and intelligent.

We are currently looking for graduate trainees to join
us. 

Would you be interested?

Yours ever,

Lady Agatha Bristol, CBE
Head of Special Operations, Foreign Office, London

messages.body:
Princess Margaret and her entourage send Cedrax Woumfo to school. Will he make the grade? But wait! Mr. Woumfo is doing his homework and has found Scamorama!  But WAIT AGAIN! Mr. Woumfo just won't give up! He doesn't trust the Princess anymore, so she reveals her true identity as... Dr Harold Shipman. Cedrax finally got annoyed and told Dr Shipman where to get off on july 7.
July 12: But WAIT! Cedrax (where do they get these names? science-fiction novels? cookie boxes?) tries to sic Princess Margaret on a different scammer! (His rival? A buddy?) More rudeness ensues.

Starring:




and by special permission from Actors Equity

and now

messages.subject: study
messages.body:
Attn:Pricess Margaret.

       Her Royal Highness Princess Margaret VC.

       Greetings in the name of God,the merciful.

       I am Mrs Cedrax Woumfo , of a born Christly speaking French .

       My father was died suffering of diabetes in year 1990, i was only 11 year old . the life has      never   easy for me. but i havn't lose my courage , wiht the help of GOD and my Mother , going to school and praying everyday , I obtain a School leaving Examination ( Bacalaureat ).

      Afther that i decide to continue my study in England , but until today the money is a problem.
 
       However, with many transactions and the help of GOD and my muther , i become a opportunity to travel to germany . where i am presently continue to search a possibility to  study in England.

      Please Dear Sister,Princess Margaret,  can you help me to realise my wish; Invite me in England and help me to make  a master in Electrical and Electronic Engineering?

      I am waiting for your respone ,and if you have further question please let me know.

      I sincerely wish that you will never fail me.

     May God bless you and The Royal Family

      Cedrax Woumfo

Afther that i decide to continue my study in England , but until today the money is a problem.

However, with many transactions and the help of GOD and my muther , i become a opportunity to travel to germany . where i am presently continue to search a possibility to study in England.

Please Dear Sister,Princess Margaret, can you help me to realise my wish; Invite me in England and help me to make a master in Electrical and Electronic Engineering?

I am waiting for your respone ,and if you have further question please let me know.

I sincerely wish that you will never fail me.

May God bless you and The Royal Family

Cedrax Woumfo

messages.body:
My Dear Woofoo

We always like to do the most We can to help native chappies, and your tale of woe has greatly touched us. It so rarely that We can help the common person along in this way.  What exactly can We do? There is a spare room in the Miracsky Wing here which perhaps We can make available to you once we are assured of your good faith. Naturally there will be formalities to complete, but would this be of interest? There is also television and an X Box not being used,and  which I am sure Princess Wayne has finished with that can be provided in case you do not find your just deserts at once.

MARGARET

Her Royal Highness Princess Margaret VC, Duchess of Great Tesco, Stewardess of Llareggub, Prioress of Lotto,
Room 101
The Royal Les Dawson Suite
Kensington Doss House,
Buckingham
London
FU2 GlT

messages.body:
Her Royal Highness Princess Margaret VC.

       Greetings in the name of God,the merciful.
      
       Dear Sister , Princess Margaret.
 
      How are you today ? with heart full of joy , i just want to thank you , and write today regarding your last email correspondence with me.

        I am presently in ( munich ) Germany and to preparings for coming to England. I need to enable me to apply  for a visa in British Embassy or high Commission some documents .

     First:   An official notification of Admission in one University in london. You can help me to have that , the University would tell you what documents is necessery for that , and i would send it to you, Note that i want to study in The  Electrical & Electronic Engineering programmes.

    Second:  Please you have to send me a special official Formal obligation for brearing the study costs.

      I want to thank you first for the spare room in the Miracsky Wing  , the Television and the X box.

     I am waiting for your respone ,and if you have further question please let me know.

     I sincerely wish that you will never fail me.

     Have a nice and peaceful weekend

     May God bless you and The Royal Family

      Cedrax Woumfo

messages.body:
My Dear Chap

A pleasure to hear back from you so promptly, and of course We shall pleased to do all We can to ease your passage to these shores.

I have taken the liberty of contacting the Chancellor of Royal Smegaroon University, just outside London and things are looking very encouraging as far as admitting you. You may be asked to attend a short interview but with my backing this will be a mere formality.

Please let us have a copy of your international passport and all supporting documentation as soon as possible, quoting refence 1 PIL OCK.

I have asked Lonslo Tossov the Royal Interior Designer to refurbish the Miracsky Room as befitting a native chap from the colonies and he asks what sort of decor will suffice. I have provisionally selected a green and banana yellow flock with some attractive wicker furniture, but am open to suggestions on this before finalising the selection. Will Splinter Cell be adequate for the X-Box by the way? It comes highly recommended by the Prince.

We await to hear from you as soon as possible on all matters.

MARGARET

messages.body:
My Dear Mr Woumfo

A pleasure to hear from you as always my dear chap. I have asked the Chancellor of Royal Smegaroon, Mr Charles Farnes-Barnes to provide the website address and all the necessary convocational details. He is an excellent fellow and I am sure that he will provide all the information you require. In the meantime you may wish to look at the facilities offered by the sister establishment Kings College, my own alma mater, which is very similar in all critical respects. You may see this at http://www.kcl.ac.uk/ I am not sure if you can bring any of your wives to study as well and you may wish to raise this point.

As for my postal address please use the one as given below.

I have noted your preference as far as decor is concerned, an excellent choice. Shall I arrange for your room to contain a tiger skin rug or two or lay in some gin to make you feel at home? Please let me know as I am keen to ensure you get what you deserve.

Best regards

MARGARET

messages.body:
My Dear Mr Woumfo

A pleasure my dear chap to hear from you so promptly. We are interested to know of which exams you have passed. I know that the London Universities particularly value the Tardis Business Diploma.  Perhaps you would be so good as to scan in and send your qualifications to Mr Farnes Barnes to peruse, as it will make his final decision that much easier? I saw him for a glass of port at the St Trininans inauguration last night, and he more or less gave his blessing to the whole idea.

Plans for the redecoration of the room for your arrival are already well advanced. Would you prefer to sleep in a bed or on the floor? I don't know what you are accustomed to over there.

Kind regards

MARGARET

messages.body:
My Dear Mr Woumfo

May I suggest that you compress your documents with a utility like WinZip or send them one at a time? Time is too short to go around opening e-mail accounts all over the place, especially German ones. We are very worried about viruses and the like and some of these foreign accounts can be rather unreliable.

Alternatively perhaps you could courier over the information to us here at the Palace? We shall, of course off full reimbursement once you are our guest.

Do hurry up old chap, as I am seeing Mr Farnes Barnes for a game of croquet next tuesday and we really want to move on and get these outstanding details resolved. He is expressing great interest in your plea and I think he will look favourably on your claims.

Work has already started on your room and I must the say the colour scheme is very fetching. If you wish to pursue any musical interests, by the way then there are som tom toms in the drawing room.

Best wishes

MARGARET

messages.subject: TO MR WOUMFROO
messages.body:
Dear Cedrax (if I may be so bold)

Unfortunately your documents have not been received, and We are worried lest you are not entirely serious in the matter. Our Mr Tossov, who has been working hard on your accomodation (he has ordered the potted palms and wicker furniture only yesterday) has had some particularly harsh words to say about this. Please, what is happening? I am very concerned.

MARGARET

messages.body:
My Dear Cedrax

This is excellent news. You may fax items to Me at my hunting lodge :

00 44 1 527 854228.

and I will see that they get the attention they properly deserve.

How soon will it be before the main items arrive in the post? I am eager to get this matter expedited. I hope that you have written the address clearlyand  in ink, as I know a foreign education can easily produce something of an illegible scrawl if in written in excited haste.

best regards

MARGARET

ps Tossov asks if you would like an overhead fan in your room to make your feel at home? It is not very hot here at present, but the reassuring swoosh may help you sleep.

Mr Dear Cedrax

I fear that the well meaning person you spoke to misunderstood. My dear mother, the late Princess Margaret, Grand Duchess of Trumpton, did indeed pass away a while back and I am surprised that you did not remember the state funeral at Butlins Abbey, widely covered in the media at the time.

As her eldest daughter I bear the same name (a tradition passed down several generations, I may add) and this has obviously led to some confusion. I am alive and well, as you can see from the attached picture, taken just this weekend.

If you do not intend to proceed with this business then We shall be disappointed, but that must be your decision. There is no need to invent reasons and to assert that we are dishonest if that is what you are doing perhaps? I have a number of deserving cases from your part of the world who I can spend more time on.

Kind regards

MARGARET

Her Royal Highness Princess Margaret VC, Duchess of Great Tesco, Stewardess of Llareggub, Prioress of Lotto,
Room 101
The Royal Les Dawson Suite
Kensington Doss House,
Buckingham
London
FU2 GlT

messages.body:
My Dear Mr Woumfou

After re reading your message several times a sense of shame crept over me and tears filled my eyes. I must apologise for the distress I have caused you by my ill-judged joking. After examination of your messages I realise that you are no cheap crook sitting in a internet cafe, no mugu 419 scam boy on the make, but a serious claimant for charitable consideration. Perhaps, somehow, I can make amends and bring the sunshine back to your life. I am alas no Princess, but you have the right address for me so your mail will still reach me and I will naturally  look at at once.

My real name is Dr Harold Shipman and as it happens I may be able to help you, as I have academic connections with Kings College London, the web site of which you have seen. If you would prefer you can reach me on my proper e-mail, DrHarold_Shipman@hotmail.com. I have a busy practice with many patience, whom I will try and finish off so that I can give you my fullest attention.

How can I be assistance?

Hello Mr Woumfo

It is so kind of you to accept my apologies and I really intend to give your interests the treatment they deserve. I am a physician with a small practice in England and am usually very busy with a range of cases, although at the moment it is holiday season here and consequentally the waiting room this afternoon is just dead. I haven't yet received your documents. How were they sent? Please make a note of the address here of my surgery in case you have problems.

In the meantime if you need any advice on general aches or pains, beri beri, problems with impotence and the like, please let me know.

Harold

messages.subject: TO CEDRAX: is this goodbye?
messages.body:
My Dear Cedrax

I am sorry to not have heard from you again, and can only assume that you have found another supporter to aid your well deserved entrance into the UK. This is a shame, as Nurse Quims have written a few letters on your behalf (including one to Dr Crippen, the bursar at Kings College) and had penciled in quite a degree of support but we understand. I had intended to see if some of my patients might offer some practical suggestions as well, had asked several already with just a few to finish off.

However we still wish your attempt all the success it clearly deserves.

HAROLD

Mr Dear Mr Woumfou

I am very concerned about your condition, are you sure you do not want a second opinion? If you could courier over your X-Rays or temperature charts, I would be happy to give them an examination. Is yours a nervous disease, or perhaps (as I suspect more likely) something of a venereal nature?

Also does this mean our business is at an end? I would not want to place additional strain on the nerves of such a sickly and sensitive individual. As it happens though this interval is quite a relief, as I am rather buried under my work at the moment.

Harold

My dear Ceedrax

A pleasure to hear from you, and Quims and I are quite relieved that you are still with is. We were growing quite concerned about the length of time you have been out of contact and feared the worse. I am very concerned about the condition you describe. An ulcerous duodeum can be very painful and, occasionally, even life threatening. I am assuming that you are drinking plenty of milk or yoghurt and adhering to a strict regime of soft vegetables and ice cream? If you have any more information about the impacta lesion itself, perhaps with a wankerscan reading from your physician or wise man, then I will be pleased to offer my second opinion. In the short term, exploratory rectal surgery may be desirable as a corrective measure, and I would advise the purchase of a rubber ring from your local market to anticipate this instance.

I am amazed that you are having problems making contact with this office, as everything is working fine and has been checked for faults on recently. Indeed I have received several faxes and calls this morning (a local newspaper is doing a piece on the newsworthy aftercare we offer our patients) without any difficulty. Perhaps this explains why the lines have been busy.

If you still cannot make headway let me know and I will see if I can suggest another contact number.

I am very eager now to see matters progress and look forward to seeing you get what you obviously deserve.

HAROLD

messages.body:
My Dear Cedrax

My apologies in the delay in getting back to you and there does seem to have been a communication problem between us. Here I was waiting for some further information from you and all the time you were requiring some details from me! Things have been further complicated by my necessary absence, being away at the Aberdeen Incontinence Conference, at which I was giving a address. The organisers sponsor the British Marathon movement, and you can imagine I had plenty of other duties as they had the runs all day. Well I can certainly look to rectify matters now, my friend, and let us get this business back on course.

You can contact me on 44 906 121 3012, fax 3013 and I will be pleased to hear from you.

How is your own treatment going? Have you tried the diet I have suggested? Please keep me up to date.

Your friend

HAROLD
